intro: The chairman of Ukraine's Central Election Commission has said that Petro Poroshenko has been elected president of Ukraine.
content: The chairman of Ukraine's Central Election Commission has said that Petro Poroshenko has been elected president of Ukraine.

Commission Chairman Mykhaylo Ohendovskyy told a press briefing in Kyiv that there will be no need for a second round of the presidential election, as Poroshenko received enough votes to be declared the winner outright.
Briefing in Kyiv that there will be no need for a second round of the presidential election, as Poroshenko received enough said that has been elected president of Ukraine.
Ohendovskyy said, "Ukraine's new president, Petro Poroshenko, was elected on May 25.
The commission said that, with more than 90 percent of the vote processed, Poroshenko had more than 54 percent of the vote, followed by former Prime Minister Yulia Tymoshenko with 13 percent.
The commission said that, with more than 90 percent of the vote processed, Poroshenko had more than 54 percent of the vote, followed by former Prime Minister Yulia Tymoshenko with 13 percent.

comments.author: Victor Cala
comments.content: A lot of what happened made little sense. The ones that developed the offending products simply left. Then the government punished the stakeholders of the entities, via fining. This punished stockholders, who knew nothing of the situation a priori. Many of these stakeholders were people with pensions and 401Ks. How wise were these actions? Read more: Obama 2015 Budget Proposal: Tax Hikes for Rich, Cuts for Middle Class | TIME.com

comments.author: Charles Zippovitch
comments.content: One morning, when Gregor Samsa woke from troubled dreams, he found himself transformed in his bed into a horrible vermin. He lay on his armour-like back, and if he lifted his head a little he could see his brown belly, slightly domed and divided by arches into stiff sections.

widgetThumbnails.heading_h3: South Korea, Japan Support UN North Korea Warning
widgetThumbnails.paragraph: South Korea and Japan have welcomed a declaration by the UN Security Council threatening punitive measures if North Korea carries out a nuclear test
